title: Test overflows stack as a doctest, but runs fine as a regular test

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: I-compilemem
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to memory usage during compilation.

labels.name: A-doctests
labels.description: Area: Documentation tests, run by rustdoc

body:
I recently added this doc test to the `lib.rs` of my crate:

https://github.com/LPGhatguy/rbx-dom/blob/493ce5a4f5c3da6932c51e003987e2cbd69eecf7/rbx_xml/src/lib.rs#L13-L39

When I try to run it through `cargo test`, I get a stack overflow that contains none of my own code, and not very many stack entries:

![dpX8vyi](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/654598/57576788-13688000-741d-11e9-8515-3a60371319a2.png)

When I run this same test as a regular test, it passes just fine.

I tried running the test on today's nightly, as well as with a larger stack (`RUSTFLAGS="-C link-args=/STACK:8194304" cargo t`) and it still occurs. After talking with Arnavion on IRC, I verified the stack size using dumpbin.

Wrapping the entire doctest in `std::thread::spawn(|| { ... })` causes the test to no longer overflow the stack.

This issue **does not** happen on Linux on Travis-CI; here are the test results for Rust 1.31.0 and 1.34.1 (stable) for the same commit: https://travis-ci.org/LPGhatguy/rbx-dom/builds/531288814

Config:
- Windows 10 v1809
- VS Build Tools 2017
- rustc 1.34.1 (fc50f328b 2019-04-24)
